title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When I answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the file opens quickly. However, if I repeat the same steps and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes around 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original file content.
EB: I would expect that reverting the file contents should not take more time than simply closing and reopening the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog. 
2. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 
3. Repeat steps 1 and 2. 
4. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor. 
5. Observe that it takes about 15 seconds for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original file content.
